result.title: Summary of 1st open innovation and project emergence workshop
result.description: Within the scope of the first event, an open innovation workshop will be organized to allow the emergence of project ideas from the the members of the start-up ecosystems, the corporate players and generally speaking the stakeholders of the considered applicative domain. A summary of the workshop will be created, focusing on presenting the possibilities to transform the emerging ideas into collaborative projects and the opportunities for European start-up.

result.description: "This deliverable is an update of ""Technical Roadmap v1.0"". It will define the Technical Roadmap for all of the activities within WP3, incorporating inputs from all of the tasks. result.title: Mid-Term Report
result.description: This report will provide an opportunity to reflect on the state of the project and to make adjustments in the event that research to date suggests a change in time-line or requires a reformulation of tactics. The report will give an overview of the use of resources participant contributions; VIRT-EU activities, research integration and dissemination progress as well as summarize communication and outreach efforts. The report will also provide an evaluation and assessment of impacts and milestones to date.

result.title: Digital Trends Map
result.description: A Digital Trends Map for the Agro food, Forestry and Environment sectors will be produced, taking into account existing digital value chain frameworks as a starting point to identify and elaborate on potentially valuable intersections between digital trends / opportunities and needs / challenges of the forestry, environment and agro-food sectors. The Map will be worked out throughout the entire WP with the help of experts and stakeholders and will lead to a final version where those intersections shall be clearly mapped and inspire proposals for ICT-based solutions.

result.title: Design Options Paper
result.description: In line with IPF recommandations, the DOP will be made as a guide or tool for the innovation agencies, department or similar organisations for the development of knowledge/technology ecosystem at regional level. It will identify and explore options to address the identified challenge and show that certain decisions made in the design preclude some other options. The DOP will as well serve as guide and source of inspiration for other agencies that become interested in the topic only later and did not participate in the initial TRANSINNOV project.
